facts: Sam's neighborhood has a common scheme requiring minimum 2,000 sq ft homes
The restriction was in Tom's deed when he purchased 10 years ago
Tom wants to build a 1,200 sq ft accessory dwelling unit
All other homes in the area comply with the minimum size requirement
asp_facts: property_claim(claim10). claimant(claim10, neighbors). respondent(claim10, tom). claim_type(claim10, equitable_servitude). property_type(claim10, residential_lot). restriction_type(claim10, minimum_size). minimum_size_sqft(claim10, 2000). common_scheme_exists(claim10, yes). restriction_in_deed(claim10, yes). years_owned(claim10, 10). proposed_structure_size(claim10, 1200). neighborhood_compliance(claim10, high).
question: Can neighbors enforce the restriction through equitable servitude?
rationale: An equitable servitude arises when there is a common scheme, notice to the purchaser (through the deed), and intent to create mutually enforceable restrictions. Neighbors can enjoin Tom's non-conforming construction.
